description.narrative:
Following from a campaign Mekong visit of Mr. Sai, and public influencer to have boat trip a long the Mekong and its tributaries todocuments the experiences and the issues of riverine communities are facing with the water and documents about beauty and the mighty of the Mekong. Oxfam needs to work with Bophana Center who host the Cambodia Film Festival event in June 2022 in order to premierthe Mekong documentary films produced during Sai's field trip.
To jointly organize film festival and promote visibility of wonder of the Mekong through playing 3 episodes of Sai campaign along the Mekong River by promoting its eco-tourist for sustainable use of natural resource that should be promoted and protected its ecosystem and biodiversity for future generation.
Followings are the activities to that Bophana Center needs to deliver:
- Special Premiere of « BOAT WITH SAI » (90-120 minutes) : OXFAM Special participation during MEKONG DISCOVERY Days (details and amendments to this proposal are open for discussion) Date : June 30th and July 1st -10 AM until 10 PM @ Chaktomuk Theater (up to 700 seats) Special Premiere of « BOAT WITH SAI » (90-120 minutes) :
In the presence of SAI and community representatives Screenings of 3 films (duration 7 to 15 minutes per film) Introduction Stories from grass-root community representatives Q <(>&<)> A with the audience with SAI and community representatives - Panel discussion on MEKONG Issues and Challenges (30-60minutes): - Moderated by Bophana Center - Panelists of Mekong experts (including OXFAM suggestions) - Topics to be defined - OXFAM Booth information table (ALL DAY) - Exhibition of photos from « BOAT WITH SAI » - MEKONG DISCOVERY Days - Invitations from OXFAM : 150 tickets/Guest list - OXFAM Authorised to conduct PRESS RELEASES « in partnershipwith CIFF / or Cambodia International Film Festival »

participating-org.narrative: ASSOCIATION POUR LA RECHERCHE, LA PRODUCTION ET L'ARCHIVAGE DE DOCUME

Bophana is the name of a young Khmer woman who was a prisoner at S21, a former high school in Phnom Penh turned into a prison by the Khmer Rouge. Bophana continued to write letters to her fiancé, breaking the Khmer Rouge#s interdiction of love and private life. She died in the prison at 25, after being tortured for more than five months. By adopting the name of Bophana, the Center is passing on the message of resistance, courage and dignity left for future generations by this woman through her letters and her heroic story. Bophana Center was launched, it was designated as the Bophana Audiovisual Resource Center.
Co-founded by film director Rithy Panh, the Bophana Center collects film and sound materials related to Cambodia and gives the public free digital access to this unique heritage. The large quality database attracts a diverse and wide audience, including Cambodian youth, teachers, students, scholars, tourists, and journalists. These archives are also brought to life through conferences, debates, exhibitions, and workshops organizedby the Center. Bophana also trains young Cambodians in cinema, audiovisual creation and new media, inspiring meaningful productionsabout their own culture. A place of exchange and interaction, the Bophana Center also supports creation in all its forms by welcoming artists: we create the archives of tomorrow.
- Goal, Vision, mission and value
Vision: Bophana Audiovisual Resource Center-ARPAA strives to become a leading non-profit and non-governmental archive center in the country and region in terms of reviving memory of the country and fostering Cambodian culture through arts and multimedia. Goals: To accomplish the two missions, Bophana Center-ARPAA aims to do as the followings: 1. Revive memory through archive collecting and safeguarding 2. Provide the public free digital access this unique heritages 3. Train people in cinema and audiovisual creation, enabling them to find their own voice by respecting the Gender Equality 4. Produce a wide range of audiovisual works about Cambodia 5. Diffuse the audiovisual documents through social media, website, application, television, festival and cultural events.
Core Values: - Uniqueness - Integrity - Diversity - Inclusivity - Discovery - Development
